subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to automatically run two complete sets of tests?
msgSnippet: ... It seems to me that the use of a property file makes it a runtime configurable option:  just launch your test by pointing them to a different property
messageBody:
On 6/2/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
>
> Sounds like it's time to refactor so this isn't a problem. Make it a
> runtime configurable option, instead of something controlled by a
> property file.


It seems to me that the use of a property file makes it a runtime
configurable option: just launch your test by pointing them to a different
property file.

TestNG's answer to this is test groups: put your test methods in various
groups, e.g. "fake" or "jdbc" and then run just that group.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
